duties_responsibilities.duty: Proactive maintenance of computer environments by analyzing requirements, resolving problems, and installing hardware and software solutions.
Onsite and remote installation and support for workstations, servers, printers, networks, VoIP systems, and vendor-specific hardware and software.
First point of contact for inbound requests, leveraging strong commitment to customer service with an aptitude for problem-solving.
Performing scheduled software/hardware system checks & upgrades, and training others outside the department regarding troubleshooting techniques.
Providing technical support to employees and customers using phone, email, and the ticketing system; communicate to clients and assure compliance with all policies and procedures.
Developing expertise in in-house applications, maintaining and tracking of computers, telephones, and peripheral devices.
Conducting user training on hardware, software systems & peripheral devices and constantly improving client service, perception, and satisfaction.
Recording accurate and comprehensive information for requests, incidents, and resolutions, and documenting internal processes and procedures.
Facilitating a feedback loop between end-users, IT team, and other business functions, and conducting user training on hardware, software systems & peripheral devices.
Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively, learn quickly and adapt to changing requirements, and travel to assigned branches.

education_certification.credential: A degree in Computer Technology or related discipline; or an equivalent combination of experience and education.
A minimum of at least 5 years PC, Networking troubleshooting/repair and cabling experience and have at least two current certifications.
